intro: Galearis cyclochila, commonly known as the cyclochila larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in alpine and subalpine environments. It has basal leaves that are palmately lobed and stems that are often hairy. Galearis cyclochila is known for its medicinal properties, though it contains toxic alkaloids that can be harmful if ingested.
